in-case-problem-check-forum: If you have some troubles, you can check Gladys forum
welcome-sentence-installation: Welcome in the installation page of Gladys !
before-installing-sentence-installation: Before installating Gladys, be sure that you have followed the configuration step on Gladys project website.
thank-you-for-installing-gladys: Thank you very much for installing Gladys
gladys-only-work: Gladys is free, and only work because people use it. If you want developers to join the project, you can use the Twitter share button to help the project. Thank you :)
here-you-can-register-machine: Here you can register the machine who are running Gladys. Useful if you have multiple Gladys instance ( on a server and on a Raspberry for example ).
the-master-field-machine: The Master field indicate that the machine is the master of your installation.
the-me-field-machine: The "Me" field indicate that the machine you are registering is the machine where your are actually connected to ! (on this interface).
dashboard-default-box-text: You are on the dashboard of Gladys. To add boxs on this dashboard, go to "Parameters" then "Boxs".
installation-welcome-sentence-installati: You need to first create your account
installation-welcome-data-information: This account is local to this machine and data will never be uploaded anywhere.
installation-invalid-password: Invalid password, you should have a minimum of 5 characters.
installation-invalid-birthdate: Invalid birthdate, should be in format YYYY-MM-DD.
installation-configuration-success: I just configured myself successfully ! You can move to next step :)
search-placeholder: What can I do for you ?
parameters-box-text: Box are widgets, on the homescreen for example. X and Y are the position of the box in the grid. (x=1,y=1) is top left. (x can be only 1 or 2)
scenario-conditions-explained: You can add as much conditions as you want, your actions will be executed only if all conditions are fulfilled.
scenario-actions-explained: You can add as much actions as you want. Your actions will be executed in parallel. If you want more control, don't hesitate to create a script !
area-box-description: Zones are defined places. When you enter into a specific zone, it creates an event in Gladys. It allows you to create scenarios like "When I'm back at home" => Do a specific action.
house-box-description: You can define here your houses in Gladys. Latitude and longitude can be found on Google Maps, and must be entered with the format (example): Latitude = 42.1, Longitude = 40.1. Remember, all this is saved on your machine and do not leave your Gladys installation.
mode-box-description: Modes are states the house can take. A house can be in one and only one mode at the same time.
token-description: Token are keys allowing you to contact Gladys HTTP API remotely. For example, to get houses : GET http://GLADYS_URL/house?token=YOUR_TOKEN
param-box-description: Parameters is a key-value association table in database which allows modules to store API keys, tokens without needing to create a specific table or asking the user to modify config files. Each key is unique. These key-value are cached in RAM for max performance, so please don't save heavy data in there. These parameters are globals for all users !
param-user-box-description: User Parameters are key-value association for a specific user. This works exactly like parameters, except that here it is specific foreach user.
system-box-description: Welcome in Gladys parameters ! Here you can see your system and configure your installation.
system-memory-used: Total Memory used on the machine
system-update-sentence: To update Gladys, start the script :
notification-box-description: Here, you can organize the different ways for Gladys to communicate with you. For example, you probably want Gladys to talk to you first if you are at home, then she can try to notify you on your desktop, and finally if you are far away she can just send you a mobile notification ! You just have to organize here the different priorities of each notification service. Easy, isn't it ?
module-install-description: You can install here modules manually from a git repository. The slug is a unique name, it correspond to the folder in api/hooks where the module will be saved.
module-install-installed-success: Module installed with success ! Reboot is needed.
alarm-cron-rule-text: You can define here cron rules. The format is simple, for example if you want to schedule an alarm each hour, simply enter : '0 0 * * * *'. More informations here :
alarm-auto-alarm-text: The goal of this feature is to wake you up at the right moment. It uses: The first event of the day in your calendar + travel time to destination + preparation time you need. Be sure you have everything set up ( calendar + a direction module + your geolocation ) before creating an auto alarm.
user-box-description: You can manage here your Gladys account. This account is local, your user informations are never stored anywhere, just in your local machine.
user-preparation-time: Preparation time you need in the morning (in seconds)
login-error-password-email-required: Please enter an email and a password.
all-user-box-description: You can manage here all Gladys accounts.
default-answer-gladys-brain: I don't have the answer, I'm sorry :/
system-gladys-rebooting-text: Gladys is rebooting... Waiting for Gladys to be available again. This page will reload automatically !
